task_description: Facing the building to your East (approx. 104°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the top of the building to estimate total height, so I should tilt the camera upward while keeping the same heading toward the building.
My view is no longer aimed east at the target building, so I should rotate right to 90° to re-acquire the building while keeping the upward pitch.
To estimate the building height I need to see its roofline, so I should tilt up while still facing east toward the structure.
The heading has snapped back to north again, so I need to rotate right to face east (90°) to keep the building in view for height estimation.
I should stop rotating and give a height estimate from the visible facade by assuming a typical ~3.5 m per story and counting about 4 stories to the roofline.
